subclassFeature.name: Path of the Blood Knight
entries: Your Rage has always been inside you, driving you toward the chaos of battle. You are a Blood Knight, a warrior who lives for the chaos and violence of battle. Always looking for more powerful foes to test yourself against, your savage power will grow the longer you remain in combat. A Blood Knight never admits defeat; they will find victory or die in the attempt.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Knight Exploits
entries: You learn certain Exploits at the barbarian levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your number of Exploits Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Fervor
entries: The violence of battle stokes your Battle Fervor, which you can use to fuel various Barbarian features, as shown here:

items.name: Gaining Favor
items.entry: You gain 1 Charge of Fervor whenever you enter a Rage, when you start your turn in combat while you are Raging, when you score a critical hit, and whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points. The maximum Charges of Fervor you can have is equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you lose all Charges when you stop Raging or if you are incapacitated.

items.name: Furious Focus
items.entry: When you make a weapon attack, you can expend 1 Charge of Fervor to add one roll of your Exploit Die to your attack roll or your damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Furious Superiority
entries: Your otherworldly focus fuels your combat skills. Once per turn, you can expend Fervor in place of Exploit Dice to use one Exploit you know by expending 1 Charge of Fervor per degree of the Exploit. However, you roll d4s in place of any Exploit Dice you would normally roll as part of that Exploit.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior's Focus
entries: You constantly stoke the fury that drives your lust for battle so you are always ready to fight. You only lose Charges of Fervor when they are expended, if you are incapacitated, or when you finish a short or long rest. You no longer lose your Charges of Fervor your Rage ends.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Lust
entries: The whirlwind of blood and steel drives you to fight onward. Whenever you take damage, you can use a reaction to expend Charges of Fervor to reduce that damage by one roll of your Exploit Die per Charge of Fervor you expended.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of War
entries: You are a terror to behold on the field of battle, and often likened to the second coming of a god of war. While Raging, you can use a bonus action to expend 1 Charge of Fervor to move up to your walking speed and make one melee weapon attack with advantage. On hit, you regain 1 Charge of Fervor.
